title: Create or update a knowledge/news article
content:
Create an article

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Knowledge > Articles or Build > Knowledge > News.
  2. Click New.

  3. Enter the details of the article or news item. See the Knowledge/News article details section below.

    1. Provide a title and content.

      You can drag and drop file attachments into the Content area so they will be visible in the Service Portal.

    2. Set a level of importance.

      This is more relevant for news articles. News articles that are marked Critical alert are displayed first in the News articles widget. For more information, see Importance in the Article details section below.

    3. Set a level of promotion. The value in this field controls the order in which items display in Service Portal.

      The priority order of the display is:

      • Recommended

      • Normal

      • Deprecated

    4. Select the service to which the article or news item is related.

    5. Specify the appropriate audiences. This entitles users in the selected audiences, defined by location and user group, to view the article or news item.
      Note that when you add audiences, you can add up to 200 records at a time. For example, if you need to add 300 audiences, you may add the first 200 records and save, and then add the other 100 records.

      Audiences are defined in Administration > Master Data > People > Entitlement Rules. For more information, see How to manage entitlement rules.

    6. Attach related files.

      Files attached in the Attachments section aren't visible in the Service Portal.

  4. To preview how the article or news item will look in the Service Portal, click the Preview  button on the toolbar.

  5. Save the article or news item.

    The article or news item is added to the list in the Draft phase. The article or news item must be reviewed, and then published internally or externally before users can view it. For more details see the Update an article section below.

Update an article

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Knowledge > Articles or Build > Knowledge > News.

  2. Select the article or news item you want to update.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

    You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  4. To update the details, click the General tab. For more information, see the Knowledge/News article details section below.

  5. To preview how the article or news item will look in the Service Portal, click the Preview  button on the toolbar.

  6. To move the article or news item to the next phase in its lifecycle, click the relevant phase. Service Management users can view articles or news items that are published internally. Articles or news items that are published externally can also be viewed on the Service Portal users by the specified audiences.

    Click the Workflow tab to view the workflow metaphases and phases for the article. For more information about the article workflow, see Knowledge/News article workflow.

  7. To design, create, and edit tasks, click the Task plan tab. The tabs that appear under task plan are Draft, Publish, and Archive, with each matching a workflow phase which may require completion of a task. The parenthesized number on the tab is the number of tasks in each phase.

  8. To add and monitor the approval plans for the article, click the Approvals tab. The parenthesized number on the tab is the number of approvals. For more information about the task plan, see Task plans.

  9. To relate other knowledge and news articles to the current record, click the Related knowledge tab. Click   Add to open the Add related record dialog box. Select the required article and add it. To remove a related article, select it and click  Remove, and then OK.

  10. To open, join, or view a discussion or to view or post comments, click the Discussions tab. For more information, see Discussions.

  11. To view changes or updates made to the record, click the History tab. For more information, see History.

  12. Save your changes.

Knowledge/News article details

Content

Field Description
Title The title of the knowledge article.
Content

The content of the article.

You can drag and drop file attachments into the Content area so they will be visible in the Service Portal.

Use the Format drop-down list to specify standard HTML formatting for sections of the article.

To display embedded media, use the following syntax:

[web-media: MediaType,MediaId]

The currently supported media types are:

  • YouTube player

    Use the following syntax:

    [web-media: youtube,iE-spGCMles]

  • SlideShare presentation

    Use the following syntax:

    [web-media: slideshare,2079340]
Event from - Event until

The duration of the event described in the news article.

Available for: News items only.

Note: When you sort the News items in Service Portal by Date, the items will be sorted by the Event from date in descending order.

Details

Field Description
Description A description that captures the details of the article or news item.
Subtype

Article or News.

This fields is read-only, and is defined automatically when creating the article.
Purpose

The purpose of the article. Select a value from the drop-down list.
Article model A collection of predefined values. Selecting the model automatically populates the relevant fields of the article.
Service

The service to which the article relates.

Services are defined in the Service Portfolio > Service Definitions. For more information, see Service definitions.
Category

The category describes the type of article. Select a value from the drop-down list.
Creation source

The source from which the article was created. Select a value from the drop-down list.
Created by The user who created the article.
Create time The time the article was created. This field is read-only.
Last update by/Last update time The last user to update the article, and the update time. These fields are read-only.

Visibility

Field Description
Active The article is active from creation until it's archived. For more information, see the Knowledge/News article details section below.
Visible Indicates whether or not the article is visible to the specified audiences.
Importance

The importance of the article.

This field is more relevant for news articles. News articles that are marked Critical alert are displayed first in the News widget in the Service Portal, and in the News listings in Service Management.

 The news articles displayed on the News sidebar of Service Portal are sorted based on Importance and creation time:
  • From top to bottom, the news articles are sorted by Importance with Critical alert > Important > Normal order.
  • The news articles with same Importance are sorted by creation time with Newest > Oldest order.
  • Up to three news articles will be displayed on the News sidebar of Service Portal. Users can click "See all news" to view all available news articles.
Promote

The value in this field controls the order in which items display in the Service Portal.

The priority order of the display is:

  • Recommended

  • Normal

  • Deprecated

Available for: Articles only.
Display start

The date and time from which the article is visible on the Service Portal.

News articles are also visible in the News widget in Service Management from this date and time.
Display until

The date and time until which the article is displayed.

Available for: News items only.
Archive on The date on which the article is to be archived.
Entitlement filter This field is available when CSM is enabled. It controls the article's visibility based on product entitlements. To understand how it affects visibility, see the Audience section on this page.

Reviewers

Enables you to select specific users to review the article.

Available when the article is in the Review phase of its lifecycle.

Review groups

Upon transition from the Draft phase to the Review phase of the article, this area is populated with the support groups that are defined in the service definition selected for the article.

You can select additional groups to perform the review.

The relevant users in these groups are automatically notified by email, alerting them to actions that must be performed.

In addition, in the Reviewers section, you can select individual users to perform the review. See the How to create or update a knowledge/news article section above.

Audience

The Audience section defines which users can view the article in the service portal. Article visibility is generally controlled through entitlement rules. However, if Customer Service Management (CSM) is enabled, you can also use product entitlements, along with entitlement rules, to control visibility.

Entitlement rules

Entitlement rules restrict access based on location, user group, role, or company. These rules can be created by administrators under Administration > Master Data > People > Entitlement Rules. For more information, see the How to manage entitlement rules page. After creating a rule, you must add it to the article’s Audience section to enforce it.

Add entitlement rule in the Audience section

  1. Click Add , then select the rule from the list or type a few characters to search for the rule.
    OR
    Click the list icon (   ) to display the available entitlement rules. 
  2. Select the checkboxes for the rules you want to add, then click OK. The selected rules appear in yellow. 
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove entitlement rule in the Audience section

  1. Select the rule and click  Remove. The selected rules appear in strikethrough text. 
  2. Click Save on the toolbar.

Product entitlements

A product entitlement record defines which users from a customer company, or its delegated companies, can view requests, create or update requests, and view articles for the product instances purchased by the customer. For more information, see the Manage entitlements page.

Restricting visibility based on product entitlements

When CSM is enabled, the Entitlement filter appears in the Visibility section. The filter provides a single option: Entitled products. Selecting this option displays the Related product model section below the Related asset model section. You must add the relevant product models in this section. As a result, in the service portal, the article becomes visible only to users who:

  • Have entitlements to view articles for product instances of the specified product models.
  • Satisfy the added entitlement rules, if any.
When you select Entitled products, you must add the relevant product models in the Related product models section. If no product models are added, the article will not be visible to any users, even those who meet the entitlement rules. If you do not want to use product entitlements to restrict access, leave the Entitlement filter unset; the article will then be visible only to users who satisfy the entitlement rules

Examples of controlling article visibility

The following examples show how entitlement rules and product entitlements affect article access.

  • Using entitlement rules only: An organization wants a knowledge article titled “How to Apply for Paid Leave” to be visible only to employees in the USA office who belong to the Sales Team group. Create an entitlement rule specifying the location as USA and the user group as Sales, and add the rule to the article’s Audience section. Only employees in the USA Sales group can view the article.
     
  • Using product entitlements only – CSM Use Case: A company provides a “Troubleshooting Guide” article for the ABC software product. Only customers who have purchased this product should view it. Set the article’s Audience section Entitlement filter to Entitled products and add the ABC product model in the Related product models section. Only users from customer companies with entitlements granting permission to view articles for product instances of the ABC product can view the article.
     
  • Using both entitlement rules and product entitlements – CSM Use Case: A company wants a “Troubleshoot Instructions” article for the ABC product to be visible only to customers who have purchased the product and are located in the USA. Create an entitlement rule specifying the location as USA and add the rule to the article’s Audience section. Set the Entitlement filter to Entitled products and add the ABC product model in the Related product model section. Only users who meet both conditions can view the article.

Usage and feedback

Displays statistical information about the article. These statistics are used to display reports about the usage of the articles.

Field Description
Votes

Displays the number of Service Portal users who rated the knowledge article as helpful.

Available for: Knowledge articles only.
Views

Displays the number of times the article was viewed.

Available for: Knowledge and News articles.

This information is updated every hour.
Used as solution

Displays the number of times the article was used as a solution to a service/support request, incident, or problem.

Available for: Knowledge articles only.

Related asset model

You can select asset model records to relate to the article. For example, if an article discusses PCs with asset models 310, 320, and 330, you would select those asset models as related to the article.

To add a linked record:

  1. Click Add or the grid icon .

  2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow.

  3. Click Save.

To remove a linked record:

  1. Select the record(s).

  2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.

  3. Click Save.

When an asset model is related to an article, the article appears in the Service Portal when viewing services or assets of the specified asset model.

Related product model

This section is visible after selecting Entitled products in the Entitlement filter within the Visibility section. In this section, you must add the relevant product model records.

If no product models are added, the article will not be visible to any users, even those who meet entitlement rules.
Only product models of type Product can be added. Product models of type Bundle or Category are not supported.

To add a related product model record:

  1. Click Add or the grid icon .
  2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow.
  3. Click Save.

To remove a related product model record:

  1. Select the record(s).
  2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.
  3. Click Save.

Attachments

Attachments related to the record. To attach a file to the record, click Add attachment.

  • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.

  • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.

  • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

Tags

You can add a Tags field to the forms for articles. Tags are an additional helpful label for articles and are searchable. If the Tags field is added to the form, users can add one or more tags to an article (use a comma to separate multiple tags). For more information, see How to edit a form.
